content.question: Communem . . . auspiciis (lines 13-14) is translated

choices.label: Therefore let us rule this common people and with equal authority
Therefore let us surround this common people with auspicious walls
Therefore let the people have a common king with our equal authority
Therefore let us rule in common this man, his people, and his auspicious walls

content.answer: Therefore let us rule this common people and with equal authority

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2
